Encord is backed by top investors, including CRV, Y Combinator, and Next47, leading industry executives like Luc Vincent, former VP of AI at Meta, and other Bay Area AI leaders. We are one the fastest growing companies in our space, and consistently rated as the best product in the market by our customers. We have big plans ahead and are looking for an ambitious Account Executive to join us in building our team.

What can you expect?
- You will be one of the first quota-carriers and SF employees at one of the fastest growing AI tooling startups, reporting to our Head of Sales & working alongside the co-founders and leadership team.
- You’ll be the engine for our revenue growth, learning how to take a product to market and scale to $millions in ARR by actually doing it.
- You will navigate complex sales cycles with the world's leading mid-market and enterprise tech businesses (from fast growing startups to Fortune 500s teams).
- You will build and manage your sales pipeline and close deals, as we expand our ideal customer profile & find successes in new sectors and geographies... hopefully you'll manage a geography/sector/team in the next 12 months.
- You will build and maintain close relationships across product, engineering, and customer success, giving feedback gathered from the front line, helping steer our roadmap, & experiencing first-hand how great products & great businesses are built.

About you
- You're ambitious, competitive, and care lots about your career. You're probably happiest when working really hard and solving challenging problems/winning deals. You know this requires dedication & some sacrifice but you think it's worth it. You want to rise faster than would be possible in any 'normal' career and you're happy to roll up your sleeves and do whatever is required.
- You're an entrepreneur and you want to be a part of building a business.
- You have good commercial intuition, and the ability to build rapport, influence people and drive change, whether it's with a distinguished exec or a junior operator. You can get on well with anyone and have the gravitas to sell to senior leadership (eg. CTOs) or the ability to learn quickly.
- You want to become exceptional at Sales and you’re looking for a company that can offer you that growth and learning opportunity to enable you to become a future leader.
- You’ve consistently performed in the top percentile of whatever environment you’ve been in, whether in academia, business, sport, sales team, or whatever else you've put your mind to.

What we Offer
- Competitive salary, commission and equity in a hyper growth startup.
- Real opportunities to grow. We’re growing insanely fast and you’ll have all the opportunities for growth that you can handle.
- Strong in person culture. We're 3-5 days a week in our newly-launched loft office in North Beach.
- Flexible PTO to recharge.
- Annual learning and development budget.
- 18 Paid Vacation Days in the US + federal holidays.
- Lots of opportunities for travel (all around the US, to London & Europe).
- Bi-annual off-sites and monthly socials.
- Health, dental and vision insurance.

title: Business Development Representative
description:
About Us

At Encord, we’re building the AI infrastructure of the future. The biggest challenge AI companies face today is actually not half as glamorous as the outside world may think: it’s all about data quality. In fact, the success of any AI application today relies on the quality of a model’s training data and for 95% of teams, this essential step is both the most costly, and the most time-consuming, in getting their product to market.

AI today is what the early days of computing or the internet were like, where the potential of the technology is clear, but the tools and processes surrounding it are still primitive, preventing the next generation of applications. We are a talented and ambitious team of 100+, working at the cutting edge of computer vision and deep learning, backed by top investors, including CRV and Y Combinator, leading industry executives like Luc Vincent, former VP of AI at Meta, and other top Bay Area leaders in AI. We are one of the fastest growing companies in our space, and consistently rated as the best tool in the market by our customers. We have big plans ahead and are looking for a rockstar Business Development Representative to join us in building our GTM team.

The Role

You’ll be the driving force behind Encord’s future growth, owning the top of the funnel and helping convert opportunities into revenue. This is a hands-on, high-impact role where you’ll master outbound strategy, develop a deep understanding of our product and customers, and play a key role in how we scale our GTM engine.

You’ll spend your time across two core areas:

Pipeline Generation: Strategically identify, research, and engage high-potential prospects across priority verticals and regions. You’ll own multi-channel outreach, craft messaging that resonates with technical and commercial buyers, and consistently create high-quality opportunities that fuel our sales pipeline. You’ll work closely with Growth and Sales to test campaigns, refine targeting, and set the standard for excellence in outbound execution.

Mid-Funnel Support: Partner with Account Executives to progress opportunities through evaluation. This includes helping shape business cases, coordinating follow-ups, supporting demos and trials, and ensuring prospects have a seamless experience from first contact through to close. You’ll gain exposure to full-funnel deal cycles and learn how to manage complex enterprise sales motions.
Within 12–18 months, you’ll be in a strong position to move into a closing, leadership, or specialist role, whether that’s Sales, Solutions, or another commercial path. High performers who demonstrate ownership and impact will have the opportunity to progress even sooner.

 About you
- You have 1-4 years of experience in a client-facing role in a high-intensity, fast-paced environment.
- You are do-er; you derive energy from owning & successfully delivering projects, and are great at balancing detail-focus with bigger-picture thinking.
- You're a great communicator and enjoy running demos, hosting workshops and building a great relationship with customers.
- You are curious and data-driven; you are eager to learn and understand the customer pain, seek data to inform your thinking, & care deeply about building solutions to those pains.
- You are highly organized and great at managing your time across many competing priorities.
- You are solutions-oriented: you don't take no for an answer and are relentless, creative and strong-willed.
- You're ambitious and care lots about your career. You're probably happiest when working really hard and solving challenging problems. You know this requires dedication & some sacrifice but you think it's worth it. You want to rise faster than would be possible in any 'normal' career and you're happy to roll up your sleeves and do whatever is required.
- You’ve consistently performed in the top percentile of whatever environment you’ve been in, whether in academia, business, sport, work, or whatever else you've put your mind to.


What we offer
- Competitive salary and equity in a hyper growth business.
- Strong in-person culture: most of our team is in the office 3+ days a week in our Fitzrovia office.
- 25 days annual leave a year + public holidays.
- Annual learning and development budget.
- Paid trips to visit prospects, attend conferences, host events across UK, Europe and US.
- Company lunches twice a week.
- Monthly socials & bi-annual off-sites.

For 95% of teams, this essential step is both the most costly, and the most time-consuming in getting their product to market.

As ex-computer scientists, physicists, and quants, we felt first-hand how the lack of tools to prepare quality training data was impeding the progress of building AI. AI today is what the early days of computing or the internet were like, where the potential of the technology is clear, but the tools and processes surrounding it are still primitive, preventing the next generation of applications. This is why we started Encord.

We are a team of 100+, working at the cutting edge of multimodal and visual AI. You'll become a product expert, and work with internal teams (technical & commercial) to build a well-oiled engine that consistently enables our customers to get up and running successfully, at scale. title: Sales Director - US (San Francisco)
description:
About Us 
At Encord, we're building the AI infrastructure of the future. The biggest challenge AI companies face today is not nearly as glamorous as the outside world may think: it's all about data quality. In fact, the success of any AI application today relies on the quality of a model's training data. For 95% of teams, this essential step is both the most costly, and the most time-consuming in getting their product to market.

As ex-computer scientists, physicists, and quants, we felt first-hand how the lack of tools to prepare quality training data was impeding the progress of building AI. AI today is what the early days of computing or the internet were like, where the potential of the technology is clear, but the tools and processes surrounding it are still primitive, preventing the next generation of applications. This is why we started Encord.

We are a team of 100+, working at the cutting edge of multimodal and visual AI. Encord is backed by top investors, including CRV, Y Combinator, and Next47, leading industry executives like Luc Vincent, former VP of AI at Meta, and other Bay Area AI leaders. We are one the fastest growing companies in our space, and consistently rated as the best product in the market by our customers. We have big plans ahead and are looking for an ambitious Sales Director to join us in building our team.

What can you expect?
- You'll start off by being one of the first quota-carriers at one of the fastest growing AI tooling startups and really "learn by doing", reporting to our Head of US Sales & working alongside the co-founders and leadership team. When successful in the role, you'll have the opportunity to build out the US commercial team
- You’ll run the engine for our US revenue growth, learning how to take a product to market and scale to $millions in ARR by actually doing it.
- You'll navigate complex sales cycles with the world's leading mid-market and enterprise tech businesses (from fast growing startups to Fortune 500s teams).
- You'll manage your sales pipeline, close deals, and work with our Head of US on GTM strategy as we expand our ideal customer profile and find success in other sectors. Ideally, you'll grow to manage a geography/sector/team within your first 12 months.
- You'll become the best person in the company at explaining and pitching our product.
- You’ll work more broadly across the business, representing us at ambassadorial events, managing our most senior relationships in region, and stepping up to help with marketing, events, community, onboarding customers, and whatever else needs to be done
- You will build and maintain close relationships across product, engineering, and customer success, helping shape our roadmap, & experiencing first-hand how great products & great businesses are built.

About you
You're ambitious, competitive, and care lots about your career. You're probably happiest when working really hard and solving challenging problems/winning deals. You know this requires dedication & some sacrifice but you think it's worth it. You want to rise faster than would be possible in any 'normal' career and you're happy to roll up your sleeves and do whatever is required.

- You have 7-12 years of experience succeeding in GTM roles in B2B SaaS companies, in which several years have been as a high-performing quota carrier.
- You're entrepreneurial and you want to be a part of building a business.
- You have good commercial intuition, and the ability to build rapport, influence people and drive change, whether it's with a distinguished exec or a junior operator. You can get on well with anyone and have the gravitas to sell to senior leadership (eg. CTOs) or the ability to learn quickly.
- You want to become exceptional at Sales and you’re looking for a company that can offer you that growth and learning opportunity to enable you to become a future leader.
- You’ve consistently performed in the top percentile of whatever environment you’ve been in, whether in academia, business, sport, sales team, or whatever else you've put your mind to.

What we Offer
- Competitive salary, commission and equity in a hyper growth startup.
- Real opportunities to grow. We’re growing insanely fast and you’ll have all the opportunities for growth that you can handle.
- Strong in person culture. We're 3-5 days a week in our newly-launched loft office in North Beach.
- Flexible PTO to recharge.
- Annual learning and development budget.
- 18 Paid Vacation Days in the US + federal holidays.
- Lots of opportunities for travel (all around the US, to London & Europe).
- Bi-annual off-sites, company lunches twice a week, and monthly socials.
- Health, dental and vision insurance.

title: Senior GTM Talent Partner
description:
About Us
At Encord, we're building the AI infrastructure of the future. The biggest challenge AI companies face today is actually not half as glamorous as the outside world may think: it's all about data quality. In fact, the success of any AI application today relies on the quality of a model's training data — and for 95% of teams, this essential step is both the most costly, and the most time-consuming, in getting their product to market.

As ex-computer scientists, physicists, and quants, we felt first-hand how the lack of tools to prepare quality training data was impeding the progress of building AI. AI today is what the early days of computing or the internet were like, where the potential of the technology is clear, but the tools and processes surrounding it are still primitive, preventing the next generation of applications. This is why we started Encord.

We are a talented and ambitious team of 100+, working at the cutting edge of multimodal and visual AI, backed by top investors, including CRV and Y Combinator, leading industry executives like Luc Vincent, former VP of AI at Meta, and other top Bay Area leaders in AI. We are one the fastest growing companies in our space, and consistently rated as the best product in the market by our customers. We have big plans ahead and are looking for our first SF-based Senior Talent Partner to join us in building our commercial team, starting with Sales (Account Execs, SDRs, Account Managers).


The Role
You will be Encord’s first recruiter on the ground in the US. You’ll be partnering with our founder and senior GTM leadership on building out our commercial function – bringing to Encord company-defining talent to sustain the next stage of our hyper-growth.

You'll work to define and execute a high-quality hiring engine. You’ll drive everything from sourcing, outreach and candidate closing, to getting our brand out, to process design. You’ll help us recruit top-tier talent and ensure candidates know Encord is one of the best places to build a career.

We are building a very different type of talent function, focused on quality rather than volume. This role is for someone who wants to be embedded with senior leaders, have real ownership, and help shape the foundations of Encord's team as we continue to scale!


About you 
- You have 3+ years of experience in a hyper-growth start-up or similarly fast-paced, high accountability environment. You know what great looks like in terms of talent and hold a high bar - but you're also pragmatic, fast-moving and solutions-oriented.
- You’re entrepreneurial and want to be part of building a business. You’re not looking for a narrow recruiter role; you want ownership, influence, and to play a key role in shaping a team through our scaling journey.
- You have a track record of exceptional performance, whether in work, academics, sports, or anywhere else you’ve applied yourself. People trust you to get stuff done & you've built a great network in the startup & scale-up ecosystem.
- You’re a ruthless prioritiser, highly organised, and focused on outcomes over inputs. You’re efficient, leveraging AI throughout all your processes, and autonomous without compromising on quality, and you always nail the basics on process, comms, and ATS hygiene.
- You’re outcomes-focused, with a strong bias to action. You don’t get stuck in process or theory, you move things forward, fast and get to the right answer by testing. You can hire for both high-volume and specialised searches for niche roles.
- You’re a great communicator, i.e. clear, concise, and persuasive. You can write great outreach, pitch to a passive candidate, have exceptional behavioural and competency-based interviewing skills, and can hold your own in a strategic conversation with senior leaders.
- You’re proactive and crave accountability. You don’t wait for instructions; you figure out what’s needed and make it happen. You can execute with little guidance & lots of ambiguity.


More about the Role & Encord
- Competitive salary, commission and equity in a hyper growth business.
- Strong in-person culture: most of our team is in the office 3+ days a week.
- 18 days annual leave a year + public holidays.
- Annual learning and development budget.
- Paid trips to visit prospects, attend conferences, host events across UK, Europe and US.
- Company lunches twice a week.
- Monthly socials & bi-annual off-sites.

Encord offers a unique opportunity to be part of a startup with a clear mission and vision. You will get to explore and build services enterprise AI use cases across many different industry verticals such as healthcare, surveillance, retail, agriculture and many more. 

Our work is at the cutting edge of computer vision and deep learning, which also includes working on solving unsolved problems within those fields.

title: Associate Back-End Engineer
description:
About Encord

At Encord, we're building the AI infrastructure of the future. One of the biggest challenges AI companies face today is data quality. The success of any AI application relies heavily on the quality of its training data, yet for most teams, this crucial step is both the most costly and time-consuming. We’re here to change that.
As former computer scientists, physicists, and quants, we’ve experienced firsthand how a lack of tools to prepare quality training data impedes progress in building AI. We believe AI is at a stage similar to the early days of computing or the internet—where the potential is clear, but the surrounding tools and processes are still catching up. That's why we started Encord.

We are a talented and ambitious team of 100+, working at the cutting edge of computer vision and deep learning. Backed by $30M in Series B funding from top investors like CRV and Y Combinator, we’re one of the fastest-growing companies in our space. We have big plans ahead and are looking to expand our Engineering team to help us in building a better product for our customers.

Who we are looking for

We're looking for an outstanding engineer to push our platform to the next level. You'll join us at a crucial stage of accelerated development for the company, product and team. As part of a small, highly collaborative group, you'll drive our product and team to new heights.
Encord is growing rapidly, with our product as the key driver of that growth. A year ago, we were a team of 50; now, we’re over 100 and continuing to accelerate.

What to expect

High performing team: You'll join the small team that has built a product that our customers love and consistently rate as the best in the market. Members of the team are veterans of both Big Tech and successful startups. While the team is more than a sum of its parts, every member on the team is impressive on their own.
Impact: Your work will have direct and tangible impact for customers and in turn noticeably affect the trajectory of the company.
End-to-end ownership: You will be entrusted with end-to-end ownership of your projects. From product, design and architectural decisions, all the way to deployment, monitoring and measuring impact on users. You will work across the stack, covering everything from deployment to styling. We expect each other to take initiative, be proactive in problem-solving, and continuously seek improvements.
Autonomy and collaboration: You will often work autonomously to take charge of your projects, make decisions, and drive your work forward. On the other hand, as a lean and high trust team, we remain quick to collaborate and support each other with challenging problems together, and you will have amazing team mates to get guidance and learn from.
Scale and simplicity: You will tackle complex domains and immense scale with simple solutions. You'll leverage your expertise to solve challenging problems in simple ways.

About You

Are experienced: You have personally developed and maintained multiple systems from scratch or significantly contributed to major changes to existing systems. You know what trade offs are involved in building reliable, performant software at speed.
Seek high impact: You want your work to have a tangible outcome for people. You're not satisfied when building products that do not see the light of day or move a number by a tenth of a percent.
Are a builder: You enjoy all aspects of building not only software but a complete product and are comfortable moving across the stack when necessary. You enjoy problem solving and thinking from first principles. You’re ready to pick up new skills and build quickly.
Are comfortable with uncertainty: You're happy to tackle problems without a predefined clear definition or obvious solution, and are excited to have autonomy to make decisions as you go.
Are a team player: You understand that being a member of a high-performing team requires two things. You contribute your best work. You also help others contribute their best. You enjoy lending a helping hand when needed and levelling up those around you.

Tech stack

We are technology agnostic at Encord. We are not looking for you to have experience in all these technologies. As long as you're open to learning, please apply.
We currently use Python and Typescript across our codebase. Prior experience is appreciated but not required.
Below is a detailed breakdown of all the technologies we use.

- Backend: Python
- Frontend: Typescript and React
- Kubernetes for deployment
- GCP for underlying infrastructure
- Machine Learning: PyTorch, CUDA, Ray

We encourage people from all backgrounds, cultures and skill levels to apply. It is okay to not meet all requirements listed as we are looking for individuals who are passionate, eager to learn.

What We Offer

- Competitive salary, and equity in a hyper growth business.
- Strong in-person culture: most of our team is in the office 3+ days a week.
- Room to grow into anything you choose to — a year ago we were 50 people, now we're 100+. We'll be growing insanely fast over the next 24 months and you'll have all the opportunities for growth as you can handle.
- 25 days annual leave a year + public holidays.

Encord offers a unique opportunity to be part of a startup with a clear mission and vision. You will get to explore and build services enterprise AI use cases across many different industry verticals such as healthcare, surveillance, retail, agriculture and many more.

Our work is at the cutting edge of computer vision and deep learning, which also includes working on solving unsolved problems within those fields.

Who we are looking for

We're looking for an outstanding engineer to push our platform to the next level. You'll join us at a crucial stage of accelerated development for the company, product and team. As part of a small, highly collaborative group, you'll drive our product and team to new heights.
Encord is growing rapidly, with our product as the key driver of that growth. A year ago, we were a team of 50; now, we’re over 100 and continuing to accelerate.

What to expect

High performing team: You'll join the small team that has built a product that our customers love and consistently rate as the best in the market. Members of the team are veterans of both Big Tech and successful startups. While the team is more than a sum of its parts, every member on the team is impressive on their own.
Impact: Your work will have direct and tangible impact for customers and in turn noticeably affect the trajectory of the company.
End-to-end ownership: You will be entrusted with end-to-end ownership of your projects. From product, design and architectural decisions, all the way to deployment, monitoring and measuring impact on users. You will work across the stack, covering everything from deployment to styling. We expect each other to take initiative, be proactive in problem-solving, and continuously seek improvements.
Autonomy and collaboration: You will often work autonomously to take charge of your projects, make decisions, and drive your work forward. On the other hand, as a lean and high trust team, we remain quick to collaborate and support each other with challenging problems together, and you will have amazing team mates to get guidance and learn from.
Scale and simplicity: You will tackle complex domains and immense scale with simple solutions. You'll leverage your expertise to solve challenging problems in simple ways.

About You

Are experienced: You have personally developed and maintained multiple systems from scratch or significantly contributed to major changes to existing systems. You know what trade offs are involved in building reliable, performant software at speed.
Seek high impact: You want your work to have a tangible outcome for people. You're not satisfied when building products that do not see the light of day or move a number by a tenth of a percent.
Are a builder: You enjoy all aspects of building not only software but a complete product and are comfortable moving across the stack when necessary. You enjoy problem solving and thinking from first principles. You’re ready to pick up new skills and build quickly.
Are comfortable with uncertainty: You're happy to tackle problems without a predefined clear definition or obvious solution, and are excited to have autonomy to make decisions as you go.
Are a team player: You understand that being a member of a high-performing team requires two things. You contribute your best work. You also help others contribute their best. You enjoy lending a helping hand when needed and levelling up those around you.

Tech stack

We are technology agnostic at Encord. We are not looking for you to have experience in all these technologies. As long as you're open to learning, please apply.
We currently use Python and Typescript across our codebase. Prior experience is appreciated but not required.
Below is a detailed breakdown of all the technologies we use.

- Backend: Python
- Frontend: Typescript and React
- Kubernetes for deployment
- GCP for underlying infrastructure
- Machine Learning: PyTorch, CUDA, Ray

We encourage people from all backgrounds, cultures and skill levels to apply. It is okay to not meet all requirements listed as we are looking for individuals who are passionate, eager to learn.

What We Offer

- Competitive salary, commission and equity in a hyper growth business.
- Strong in-person culture: most of our team is in the office 3+ days a week.
- -Room to grow into anything you choose to — a year ago we were 50 people, now we're 100+. We'll be growing insanely fast over the next 24 months and you'll have all the opportunities for growth as you can handle.
- 25 days annual leave a year + public holidays.

Encord offers a unique opportunity to be part of a startup with a clear mission and vision. You will get to explore and build services enterprise AI use cases across many different industry verticals such as healthcare, surveillance, retail, agriculture and many more.

Our work is at the cutting edge of computer vision and deep learning, which also includes working on solving unsolved problems within those fields.

title: Associate Software Engineer - (Graduate)
description:
About Encord

At Encord, we're building the AI infrastructure of the future. One of the biggest challenges AI companies face today is data quality. The success of any AI application relies heavily on the quality of its training data, yet for most teams, this crucial step is both the most costly and time-consuming. We’re here to change that.

As former computer scientists, physicists, and quants, we’ve experienced firsthand how a lack of tools to prepare quality training data impedes progress in building AI. We believe AI is at a stage similar to the early days of computing or the internet—where the potential is clear, but the surrounding tools and processes are still catching up. That's why we started Encord.

We are a talented and ambitious team of 100+, working at the cutting edge of computer vision and deep learning. Backed by $30M in Series B funding from top investors like CRV and Y Combinator, we’re one of the fastest-growing companies in our space. We have big plans ahead and are looking to expand our Engineering team to help us in building a better product for our customers.


This is a full-time role starting in June or September 2026 depending on graduation dates.


Who we are looking for

We’re looking for curious, ambitious graduates who are excited to launch their software engineering careers and make an impact from day one. You’ll join us around June/September 2026 as part of a small, highly collaborative team that’s building the next generation of AI infrastructure.

At Encord, you’ll work alongside serial founders, ex-computer scientists, physicists, and quants who care deeply about building great products and shipping fast. We’re looking for graduate full-stack engineers, whether you’re more front-end or back-end leaning, who are passionate about solving real customer problems and thrive in autonomous squads of 4–5 people.

Encord is growing rapidly, with our product as the key driver of that growth. A year ago, we were a team of 50; now, we’re over 100 and continuing to accelerate. Joining us now means stepping in at a crucial stage of expansion for the company, product, and team. Your contributions here will have a real, visible impact.

If you’re finishing university and looking for your first full-time engineering role where you can learn fast, build meaningful products, and grow alongside an exceptional team, Encord could be the perfect place for you.


What to expect

High performing team: You'll join the small team that has built a product that our customers love and consistently rate as the best in the market. Members of the team are veterans of both Big Tech and successful startups. While the team is more than a sum of its parts, every member on the team is impressive on their own.
Impact: Your work will have direct and tangible impact for customers and in turn noticeably affect the trajectory of the company.
End-to-end ownership: You will be entrusted with end-to-end ownership of your projects. From product, design and architectural decisions, all the way to deployment, monitoring and measuring impact on users. You will have the opportunity to work across the stack, covering everything from deployment to styling. We expect each other to take initiative, be proactive in problem-solving, and continuously seek improvements.
Autonomy and collaboration: You will often work autonomously to take charge of your projects, make decisions, and drive your work forward. But as a lean and high trust team, we remain quick to collaborate and support each other with challenging problems together. You will work alongside amazing team-mates who will help you learn and upskill quickly.
Scale and simplicity: You will tackle complex domains and immense scale with simple solutions. You'll leverage your expertise to solve challenging problems in simple ways.


About You

Eager to learn and grow: You’ve built small projects, coursework assignments, or personal apps, and are excited to apply what you’ve learned to real-world systems. You’re curious about how reliable, high-performance software is built and are keen to learn from experienced engineers.
Motivated by impact:You want your work to make a meaningful difference. You’re excited by the idea of contributing to products that real people use and that deliver tangible results.
A natural builder: You enjoy creating things from the ground up, whether that’s writing code, designing systems, or experimenting with new technologies. You’re comfortable exploring across the stack and love solving problems
Comfortable with ambiguity: You don’t need every detail defined before you start. You enjoy figuring things out, learning as you go, and using feedback to guide your work.
Collaborative and supportive: You value teamwork, communication, and helping others succeed. You take feedback well, share ideas openly, and contribute to a positive, high-performing team culture.

title: Engineering Lead
description:
About Us

Encord is building the AI infrastructure of the future. Soon, every big company will be an AI company, and they will need to build, curate, annotate and understand big datasets to train their models. Encord helps them do this. The success of any AI application today is driven by the quality of the training data, and evaluation sets used. In most cases, creating high quality datasets are the most costly and time-consuming part of getting a product to market.

Encord is a team of AI researchers, computer scientists, physicists and quants, who felt first-hand how the lack of tools to prepare quality training data was impeding the progress of building AI. It is still early for AI. The potential of the technology is clear, but the tools and processes surrounding it are still primitive. This is why we started Encord.

We are a talented and ambitious team of 100+, working at the cutting edge of multimodal and embodied AI, backed by top investors, including CRV and Y Combinator, leading industry executives like Luc Vincent, former VP of AI at Meta, and other top Bay Area leaders in AI. We are one the fastest growing companies in our space, and are consistently rated as the best product in the market by our customers. We have big plans ahead and are looking for our Engineering Manager to join us in building our team.

Responsibilities

- Lead and manage a squad of 4-5 engineers, building our core product
- Collaborate with the cofounders, product managers, and senior engineers to define the product roadmap and ensure it aligns with the company's mission and goals
- Drive speedy delivery of high quality features and guide your team towards engineering best practices, including in code reviews, testing, and writing useful documentation
- Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and ownership within the engineering team
- Recruit, interview, hire, and onboard world-class engineers
- Mentor and coach individual engineers to help them grow and develop their skills


About you

- 5+ years of experience in software engineering, with at least 2 years of experience leading a team of engineers
- Strong technical background in computer science or a related field
- Experience building and scaling complex software systems
- Experience leading a fast-moving, high-performing engineering team
- Proven ability to recruit and develop technically excellent engineers
- Passion for building products that are loved by their users
- Excellent communication and collaboration skills
- Experience with machine learning, and in particular computer vision, robotics, and embodied AI is a plus


We encourage people from all backgrounds, cultures and skill levels to apply. It is okay to not meet all requirements listed as we are looking for individuals who are passionate, eager to learn.


What We Offer

- Competitive salary, commission and equity in a hyper growth business.
- Strong in-person culture: most of our team is in the office 3+ days a week.
- Room to grow into anything you choose to — a year ago we were 50 people, now we're at 100+. We'll be growing very quickly over the next 24 months and there will be a wide scope for you to grow into roles with greater responsibility.
- 25 days annual leave a year + public holidays.

Our work is at the intersection of cutting edge AI use cases, and the engineering challenges that come with handling massive scale. Encord offers a rare opportunity to be part of a startup with a clear mission and vision, and with exceptional product-market fit. You will get to explore and build enterprise AI use cases across many different industry verticals such as healthcare, robotics, agentic generative AI and many more.

title: Forward Deployed Engineer
description:
About us 

At Encord, we're building the AI infrastructure of the future. The biggest challenge AI companies face today is foundational – as the phrase “garbage in, garbage out” implies – the biggest challenge in engineering high performance models is all about data quality. For 95% of teams, this essential step is both the most costly, and the most time-consuming in getting their product to market.

As ex-computer scientists, physicists, and quants, we felt first-hand how the lack of tools to prepare quality training data was impeding the progress of building AI. AI today is what the early days of computing or the internet were like, where the potential of the technology is clear, but the tools and processes surrounding it are still primitive, preventing the next generation of applications. This is why we started Encord.

We are a team of 100+, working at the cutting edge of visual and multimodal AI. Encord is backed by top investors, including CRV, Y Combinator, and Next47, leading industry executives like Luc Vincent, former VP of AI at Meta, and other Bay Area AI leaders. We are one the fastest growing companies in our space, and consistently rated as the best product in the market by our customers.

The role

We’re looking for an exceptional Forward Deployed Engineer (FDE)  to join our product engineering team. Our FDEs own the deployment of the Encord platform in our most strategic and advanced use-cases – working with customers daily to drive adoption and value delivery. As an early member of the Forward Deployed team, you will have an outsized impact shaping a critical function for Encord and our customers, and stepping into a role which can accelerate your career in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.

You will become a product expert, and work with internal teams, both technical & commercial, to build a well-oiled engine that consistently enables customers to get up and running successfully, at scale. As an end-to-end owner of the deployment process, you will have a chance to work and grow on a variety of problems – technical engineering, operational excellent and strategic product work. Expect to build data integrations, guide customers with best practices, demo the product, and contribute to the product roadmap.

You’re joining Encord at an inflection point — over the last 18 months, we've built a world-class team, raised our $30M Series B (from Next47, YC, Crane) and onboarded hundreds of the leading AI companies onto Encord. If you're ready to take ownership, solve complex problems, and help define the future of AI infrastructure, this role is for you! 

About you

-You have 3-8 years of experience in a client-facing role in a high-intensity, fast-paced environment.
-You're as comfortable handling in-the-weeds product configuration queries as you are communicating to executives about a project plan. 
-You are a great communicator and are motivated by building customer relationships and solving customer problems. -You enjoy running demos, hosting workshops and shipping solutions.
-You derive energy from owning & successfully completing projects, and are great at balancing detail-focus with bigger-picture thinking.
-You are highly organized and great at managing your time across many competing priorities.
You're ambitious and care lots about your career. You're probably happiest when working really hard and solving challenging problems. You know this requires dedication & some sacrifice but you think it's worth it. You want to rise faster than would be possible in any 'normal' career and you're happy to roll up your sleeves and do whatever is required.
You’ve consistently performed in the top percentile of whatever environment you’ve been in, whether in academia, business, sport, work, or whatever else you've put your mind to

What we offer

-Competitive salary, commission and equity in a hyper growth startup.
-Real opportunities to grow. We’re growing insanely fast and you’ll have all the opportunities for growth that you can handle.
-Strong in person culture. We're 3-5 days a week in our new loft office in North Beach.
-Flexible PTO to recharge.
-Annual learning and development budget.
-18 Paid Vacation Days in the US + federal holidays.
-Lots of opportunities for travel (all around the US, to London & Europe).
-Bi-annual off-sites and monthly socials.- Health, dental and vision insurance.

title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer
description:
About Encord

At Encord, we're building the AI infrastructure of the future. One of the biggest challenges AI companies face today is data quality. The success of any AI application relies heavily on the quality of its training data, yet for most teams, this crucial step is both the most costly and time-consuming. We’re here to change that.
As former computer scientists, physicists, and quants, we’ve experienced firsthand how a lack of tools to prepare quality training data impedes progress in building AI. We believe AI is at a stage similar to the early days of computing or the internet—where the potential is clear, but the surrounding tools and processes are still catching up. That's why we started Encord.

We are a talented and ambitious team of 100+, working at the cutting edge of computer vision and deep learning. Backed by $30M in Series B funding from top investors like CRV and Y Combinator, we’re one of the fastest-growing companies in our space. We have big plans ahead and are looking to expand our Engineering team to help us in building a better product for our customers.


Who we are looking for

We're looking for an outstanding experienced engineer to push our platform to the next level of performance and reliability. You'll join us at a crucial stage of accelerated development for the company, product and team. As part of a small, highly collaborative group, you'll be a key driver of vital projects.

An engineer in this position will operate with high degrees of autonomy and will work to build and extend multiple foundational systems. They will be expected to use simple tools to craft performant, reliable and maintainable solutions to challenging problems - both technical and product.


What to expect

High performing team: You'll join the small team that has built a product that our customers love. Members of the team are veterans of both established companies and successful startups. While the team is more than a sum of its parts, every member is impressive in their own right
Impact: Your work will have direct and tangible impact for customers and in turn noticeably affect the trajectory of the company.
End-to-end ownership: You will be entrusted with end-to-end ownership of your projects. From product, design and architectural decisions, all the way to deployment, monitoring and measuring impact on users. You will work across the stack, covering everything from deployment to styling. We expect each other to take initiative, be proactive in problem-solving, and continuously seek improvements.
Autonomy and collaboration: You will often work autonomously to take charge of your projects, make decisions, and drive your work forward. But as a lean and high trust team, we remain quick to collaborate and support each other with challenging problems together.
Scale and simplicity: You will tackle complex domains and immense scale with simple solutions. You'll leverage your expertise to solve challenging problems in simple ways.


About You

Are experienced: You have seen a lot and built a lot. You have personally developed and maintained multiple systems from scratch and you know what trade offs are involved in building reliable, performant software at speed.
Seek high impact: You want your work to have a tangible outcome for people. You're not satisfied when building products that do not see the light of day or move a number by a tenth of a percent.
Are a builder: You enjoy all aspects of building not only software but a complete product and are comfortable moving across the stack when necessary. You enjoy problem solving and thinking from first principles. You’re ready to pick up new skills and build quickly.
Are comfortable with uncertainty: You're happy to tackle problems without a predefined clear definition or obvious solution, and are excited to have autonomy to make decisions as you go.
Are a team player: You understand that being a member of a high-performing team requires two things. You contribute your best work. You also help others contribute their best. You enjoy lending a helping hand when needed and levelling up those around you.


Tech stack

We are technology agnostic at Encord. We are not looking for you to have experience in all these technologies. As long as you're open to learning, please apply.
We currently use Python and Typescript across our codebase. Prior experience is appreciated but not required.

Below is a detailed breakdown of all the technologies we use.
- Backend: Python
- Frontend: Typescript and React
- Kubernetes for deployment
- GCP for underlying infrastructure
- Machine Learning: PyTorch, CUDA, Ray

We encourage people from all backgrounds, cultures and skill levels to apply. It is okay to not meet all requirements listed as we are looking for individuals who are passionate, eager to learn.


What We Offer
- Competitive salary, commission and equity in a hyper growth business.
- Strong in-person culture: most of our team is in the office 3+ days a week.
- Room to grow into anything you choose to — a year ago we were 50 people, now we're 100+. We'll be growing insanely fast over the next 24 months and you'll have all the opportunities for growth as you can handle.
- 25 days annual leave a year + public holidays.

Encord offers a unique opportunity to be part of a startup with a clear mission and vision. You will get to explore and build services enterprise AI use cases across many different industry verticals such as healthcare, surveillance, retail, agriculture and many more. 

Our work is at the cutting edge of computer vision and deep learning, which also includes working on solving unsolved problems within those fields.

title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer (Front-End Leaning)
description:
About Encord

The success of any machine learning system relies on the quality of its training data, but building high quality datasets is too slow and too expensive. Encord is building the infrastructure to solve this problem. Our platform handles the indexing, curation and annotation of huge datasets, so that our customers can efficiently build datasets, train models, and deploy their AI systems.
As AI models become more powerful and capable, they can create more economic value by handling increasingly complex tasks but only if they are suitably directed by human feedback. Expertly annotated data is the best way to do this, and Encord is well positioned to take advantage of a market which is growing extremely fast.

We are an ambitious team of 100+ working at the frontier of multi-modal AI and are backed by $30M in Series B funding from top investors like CRV and Y Combinator. We have big plans ahead and are looking to rapidly expand our Engineering team over the course of this year.


Who you are

We’re looking for great engineers with experience in building complex UIs, to help build out our editor interface. This is the part of our product that lets users visualise and annotate their data. We handle a wide range of data modalities, such as image, video, audio, text, PDFs, medical images, as well as from LIDAR and other sensors in robots and autonomous vehicles.
For this role, we are particularly looking for engineers who are excited about technically challenging front-end work, such as rendering complex 3D/4D scenes with thousands of objects, combining data from several modalities, all while maintaining high performance in the browser.

The success of any machine learning system relies on the quality of its training data, but building high quality datasets is too slow and too expensive. For this role we are particularly interested in engineers with experience in both traditional relational database systems like PostgreSQL and also column-oriented analytics systems such as Clickhouse, and who have worked on large-scale systems in industries where reliability and performance are critical.

If you want to join us and work at the forefront of what’s possible in AI then please get in touch.

title: Senior Technical Talent Partner
description:
About Us


At Encord, we're building the AI infrastructure of the future. The biggest challenge AI companies face today is actually not half as glamorous as the outside world may think: it's all about data quality. In fact, the success of any AI application today relies on the quality of a model's training data — and for 95% of teams, this essential step is both the most costly, and the most time-consuming, in getting their product to market.

As ex-computer scientists, physicists, and quants, we felt first-hand how the lack of tools to prepare quality training data was impeding the progress of building AI. AI today is what the early days of computing or the internet were like, where the potential of the technology is clear, but the tools and processes surrounding it are still primitive, preventing the next generation of applications. This is why we started Encord.

We are a talented and ambitious team of 100+, working at the cutting edge of multimodal and visual AI, backed by top investors, including CRV and Y Combinator, leading industry executives like Luc Vincent, former VP of AI at Meta, and other top Bay Area leaders in AI. We are one the fastest growing companies in our space, and consistently rated as the best product in the market by our customers. We have big plans ahead and are looking for a Senior Technical Talent Partner to join us in building our team.


Who we are looking for

We’re looking for an outstanding Senior Technical Talent Acquisition Partner to join Encord’s talent team in London, focusing on scaling our engineering and product organisation as we rapidly expand following our Series B funding last year. Partnering closely with Engineering leadership, you’ll help attract top talent and double the size of our engineering department this year.

You’ll support and lead the recruitment process for engineering roles, ensuring an exceptional candidate experience. You will also maintain a high bar for tech talent, collaborating with hiring managers to fine-tune recruitment strategies, leverage data insights, and strengthen Encord’s employer brand. Your role will be crucial in shaping Encord’s growth by strategically sourcing and securing top talent.

You’ll support and own end to end hiring across our core and Physical AI software engineering teams, as well as, Product Management, and Machine Learning. Working closely with leadership, you’ll help build the teams that will drive our continued success.

What to expect

- Manage Full Recruitment Lifecycle: Oversee the entire recruitment process, from sourcing and screening candidates to conducting interviews and facilitating the hiring process with hiring managers and teams.
- Develop Sourcing Strategies: Develop and own sourcing strategies and deliver results against those strategies for searches across various technical functions, while maintaining an inclusive and high talent bar
- ConductInterviews: Perform initial screenings and coordinate interviews with hiring managers, ensuring a thorough and efficient evaluation process.
- Assess Candidate Fit: Evaluate candidates' skills, experience, through structured interviews and assessment techniques. Develop scoring metrics to streamline decision-making.
- Build Talent Pipelines: Develop and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future job openings. Build relationships for the future with passive candidates and talent.
- Data Driven Decision Making: Leverage data and metrics to continually refine recruitment strategies and drive informed hiring decisions
- Stakeholder Management: Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills, especially with senior engineering leaders
- Onboarding Support: Collaborate with the HR team and other departments to ensure a smooth onboarding process for new hires.

About You

- You have 7+ years of experience as a tech recruiter, ideally in a fast-paced startup or scale-up environment.
- You have a proven track record of hiring exceptional engineering and product talent, consistently maintaining a high hiring bar.
- You are experimental and are open to new, creative recruiting ideas, or have experience working with hiring managers who are open to non traditional talent strategies
- You’re passionate about delivering an exceptional, inclusive candidate experience from start to finish.
- You can leverage data and metrics to refine recruitment strategies and make informed, strategic hiring decisions.
- You’re laser focused on finding and sourcing top talent, knowing that success involves relentless nurturing, creative outbound campaigns, and optimising job specs to drive better inbound results.
- You’re target-driven, detail-oriented, and have a strong sense of urgency, always finding solutions to any challenge that comes your way.

We encourage people from all backgrounds, cultures and skill levels to apply. It is okay to not meet all requirements listed as we are looking for individuals who are passionate, eager to learn.

What We Offer

- Competitive salary, commission and equity in a hyper growth business.- 25 days annual leave a year + public holidays.
- Strong in-person culture: most of our team is in the office 3+ days a week.- Monthly team events and bi-annual off sites
- Annual learning and development stipend
- Private health insurance- Team lunch twice a week
- Work with fresh Apple gear
- There's room to grow into anything you choose. We've quickly expanded to a team of 110 and are planning to double in size over the next year, which means you'll have all the opportunities for growth you can handle
- An open and collaborative culture! We value taking ownership, being customer-obsessed, embracing a growth mindset, and acing the pace - because pace is our superpower!

Encord offers a unique opportunity to join a startup with a clear mission and vision. You will have the chance to hire and work with top talent to build services for enterprise AI use cases across diverse industries, including healthcare, surveillance, retail, agriculture, and more. Our work is at the forefront of computer vision and deep learning, tackling challenging, unsolved problems in these fields.

You will be a focal point between the commercial and technical teams at Encord. Some of your responsibilities will be to:

- Support technical customer onboarding, including running technical sessions, importing/exporting data and labels into/out of our platform.
- Build scripts and tools to quickly respond to pressing customer feature requests. Support the product and engineering team in converting these point solutions into production grade features available in the main platform.
- Be the face of our engineering team with customers and prospects.
- Work alongside the commercial teams during the entire customer lifecycle and support dealmaking with your technical knowledge.
- Work with the Sales & ML team to prepare and set up product demos.

About you:
- 1+ years of experience. Previous experience as a Solutions Engineer is a plus.
- A good understanding of using Python SDKs, APIs, SQL and cloud integrations is needed.
- High attention to detail with a customer first approach.
- A hacker mindset to solve customer problems quickly and efficiently.
- Ability to estimate the scope of bug fixes and help debug code based on, e.g., stack traces from customers.
- Deal-driven attitude with the ability to work well under pressure.
- Beneficial if you have previous experience in a fast paced B2B startup.

What We Offer:
- Competitive salary, commission and equity in a hyper growth business.
- Strong in-person culture: most of our team is in the office 3+ days a week.
- Room to grow into anything you choose to — a year ago we were 50 people, now we're 100+. We'll be growing insanely fast over the next 24 months and you'll have all the opportunities for growth as you can handle.
- 25 days annual leave a year + public holidays.

Encord offers a unique opportunity to be part of a startup with a clear mission and vision. You will get to explore and build services enterprise AI use cases across many different industry verticals such as healthcare, surveillance, retail, agriculture and many more. 

Our work is at the cutting edge of computer vision and deep learning, which also includes working on solving unsolved problems within those fields.

title: TechOps Specialist
description:
About Encord

At Encord, we're building the AI infrastructure of the future. One of the biggest challenges AI companies face today is data quality. The success of any AI application relies heavily on the quality of its training data, yet for most teams, this crucial step is both the most costly and time-consuming. We’re here to change that.
As former computer scientists, physicists, and quants, we’ve experienced firsthand how a lack of tools to prepare quality training data impedes progress in building AI. We believe AI is at a stage similar to the early days of computing or the internet—where the potential is clear, but the surrounding tools and processes are still catching up. That's why we started Encord.

We are a talented and ambitious team of 100+, working at the cutting edge of computer vision and deep learning. Backed by $30M in Series B funding from top investors like CRV and Y Combinator, we’re one of the fastest-growing companies in our space. We have big plans ahead and are looking to expand our Engineering team to help us in building a better product for our customers.


Who we are looking for

We are looking for an experienced and proactive TechOps Specialist to join our fast-paced team. You will be responsible for supporting users, managing devices, maintaining networks, and ensuring smooth day-to-day IT operations. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys solving problems, working collaboratively, and is eager to grow within a dynamic work environment.


What to expect

title: Account Manager (Expansion)
description:
About Us

At Encord, we're building the AI infrastructure of the future. The biggest challenge AI companies face today isn’t model design — it’s data quality. The performance of any AI system ultimately depends on the quality of its training data, and for most teams, this remains the most costly and time-consuming part of getting products to market.

We’re now a team of 100+, working at the frontier of computer vision and deep learning. Backed by top-tier investors including CRV, Y Combinator, and industry leaders like Luc Vincent (former VP of AI at Meta), we’re one of the fastest-growing companies in our space and consistently ranked the #1 platform in the market by our customers.
We’re now looking for a driven Account Manager to join our London GTM team and help expand our footprint within some of the most advanced AI organisations in the world.

The Role
As an Account Manager (Expansion) at Encord, you’ll own and grow a portfolio of strategic UK and European customers. Your focus will be on expanding usage, driving adoption, and ensuring customers get maximum value from our platform — from autonomous vehicle companies to medical imaging teams and next-gen robotics groups.
You’ll work directly with technical and commercial stakeholders, understand their ML workflows, and identify opportunities for growth. This is a great fit for someone who loves building long-term relationships, enjoys technical conversations, and wants to help shape the future of AI infrastructure.

Responsibilities
-Own and grow a portfolio of UK/EU?? customer accounts with a focus on expansion and long-term value
-Build trusted relationships with ML, data, engineering, operations, and executive stakeholders
-Understand customers’ technical roadmaps to proactively identify expansion opportunities
-Drive upsells, cross-sells, and multi-team rollouts across existing accounts
-Partner with Customer Success, Product, and Engineering to deliver customer outcomes
-Communicate customer insights and feature requests internally
-Lead account planning, run QBRs, and develop growth strategies for your accounts
-Maintain accurate pipeline and revenue forecasting in HubSpot
-Help shape post-sales and expansion processes in a fast-growing GTM organisation

About You
-2+ years in account management, customer success, or post-sales roles in B2B SaaS
-Experience owning expansion revenue and managing mid–large ACV accounts ($50k–$250k+)
-Able to engage confidently with technical stakeholders (ML engineers, data leads, CTOs)
-Strong relationship builder with a genuine interest in solving customer problems
-Comfortable in a fast-moving, high-growth startup environment
-Experience with HubSpot, Salesforce, or similar CRM tools
-Curious, driven, and excited by the potential of AI and data infrastructure


What We Offer

You will be Encord’s first ML Developer Evangelist hire. As an AI/ML Developer Evangelist, you will be one of the leading faces of Encord’s brand in developer communities online. Your mission will be to empower ML developers to get started on Encord with access to tools and resources. Your responsibilities will include:

- You have have a Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field.
- You have previous experience working as a Machine Learning or Computer Vision Engineer or building machine learning models. 
- You're a self-starter who wants to forge your own career path.
- You're confident in being the engineering face of a rapidly growing business.
- You have a desire to grow your own personal brand within AI/ML communities.

If you don’t meet all of the requirements listed here, we still encourage you to apply. No job description is perfect, and we might find an even more suitable opportunity that matches your skills and experience.

What we offer
- Competitive salary and equity in a hyper-growth business. 
- Strong in person culture. We're 3-5 days a week in our newly-launched loft office in North Beach.

description:

We are a talented and ambitious team of 100+, working at the cutting edge of computer vision and deep learning, backed by top investors, including CRV and Y Combinator, leading industry executives like Luc Vincent, former VP of AI at Meta, and other top Bay Area leaders in AI. We are one the fastest growing companies in our space, and consistently rated as the best tool in the market by our customers. We have big plans ahead and are looking for a rockstar Senior PMM to join our Marketing team!

About You:
-Ideal candidates will have a proven record in product marketing and experience working on technical products.
-You would have a strong understanding of Data & AI platform offerings, have worked on creating messaging and positioning of technical products targeted at the enterprise market, and can build strong working relationships with stakeholders to deliver joint messaging and GTM plans.
-You also have experience creating compelling product and product-related thought leadership content to support customers on their learning journey and for Growth/Demand marketing to use for audience, use case, or vertical-specific campaigns. 
-5+ years of product marketing experience at an enterprise software company, preferably including PMM experience in early-stage AI startups
-Excellent writing skills for succinct messaging targeting AI/ML engineers and AI executivesAbility to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, team-oriented environment   
-Deep understanding of Data and AI spaceExperience building compelling technical and business content
-Works collaboratively with sales, growth marketing, and product teams
-Comfortable owning and running direct customer engagements
-Strong public speaker and technical aptitude to become the end-to-ent expert on the
-Encord platform to be able to effectively demo at events and to prospectsPreferred technical academic background (BS in computer science or related discipline)

About You
As our second product marketer, you will lead the marketing of the Encord Platform. This will include owning how we message Encord across targeted use cases, verticals, and personas. This is a critical role for the business, and you will become the subject matter expert for the end-to-end platform. 
The impact you will have
-Own the messaging of Encord, as well as the messaging for platform-wide capabilities
-Amplify the platform-level messaging through the Encord website and channels
-Build and deliver sales enablement with high CSAT scores with field teams
-Be the expert in any platform-specific messaging for any campaign or event Encord is running, and enable GTM teams with highly performant content to drive strong engagement and pipeline
-Deliver a drumbeat of compelling customer stories, highlighting the Encord Platform capabilities, technical details, and realized value
-Hone messaging by developing value proposition and messaging frameworks and driving articulation of product portfolio positioning aligned to Encord's targeted audiences and ICP
-Help build a product our customers love
-Collaborate closely with product & engineering to identify needs and sharpen product offerings based on the competitive landscape and feedback from customers

What We Offer:
- Competitive salary, commission and equity in a hyper growth startup.
- Real opportunities to grow. We’re growing insanely fast and you’ll have all the opportunities for growth that you can handle.
- Strong in person culture. We're 3-5 days a week in our newly-launched loft office in North Beach.
- Flexible PTO to recharge.
- Annual learning and development budget.
- 18 paid vacation days + federal holidays.
- Lots of opportunities for travel (all around the US, to London & Europe).
- Bi-annual off-sites and monthly socials.
- Health, dental and vision insurance.

Encord offers a unique opportunity to be part of a startup with a clear mission and vision. You will get to explore and build services enterprise AI use cases across many different industry verticals such as healthcare, surveillance, retail, agriculture and many more. 

Our work is at the cutting edge of computer vision and deep learning, which also includes working on solving unsolved problems within those fields.

title: Financial Controller
description:
At Encord, we're building the AI infrastructure of the future. One of the biggest challenges AI companies face today is data quality. The success of any AI application relies heavily on the quality of its training data, yet for most teams, this crucial step is both the most costly and time-consuming. We’re here to change that.

That's why we started Encord.

Backed by $30M in Series B funding from top investors like CRV and Y Combinator, we’re one of the fastest-growing companies in our space. We have big plans ahead and are looking to expand our Finance team to help us scale through our next stage of growth.


The Role:

The Financial Controller will be integral in shaping and ensuring the day to day running of Encord’s finance function and will play a critical role in supporting the company’s rapid scale-up, ensuring financial rigour and helping to establish a robust and future-proof finance function. This is a broad and hands-on role that covers technical accounting, global financial reporting, process improvement, and compliance.

title: Founder's Associate
description:
About Us
At Encord, we're building the AI infrastructure of the future. The biggest challenge AI companies face today is not half as glamorous as the outside world may think: it's all about data quality. In fact, the success of any AI application today relies on the quality of a model's data — and for 95% of teams, this essential step is both the most costly, and the most time-consuming, in getting their product to market.

As ex-computer scientists, physicists, and quants, we felt first-hand how the lack of tools to prepare quality training data was impeding the progress of building AI. AI today is what the early days of computing or the internet were like, where the potential of the technology is clear, but the tools and processes surrounding it are still primitive, preventing the next generation of applications. This is why we started Encord.

We are a talented and ambitious team of 100+, working at the cutting edge of multimodal AI and deep learning, backed by top investors, including Next47, CRV and YC, leading industry executives like Luc Vincent, former VP of AI at Meta, and other top Bay Area leaders in AI. We are one the fastest growing companies in our space, and consistently rated as the best tool in the market by our customers. We have big plans ahead and are looking for a rockstar Founder’s Associate to join us and help us scale.

The Role
This is a unique opportunity for an ambitious, multi-talented individual who wants to see the inside of a fast-paced scaleup and work closely with the co-founders and senior team. The ideal candidate is a superstar who is willing to work hard, roll up their sleeves and support the founders in their day-to-day tasks, while learning about every aspect of what it takes to run a fast growing business. You will work directly with Encord’s senior team and get unique visibility into an exciting, high-growth, mission-based scaleup.

Responsibilities
Your responsibilities will involve:
- Working directly with the co-founders and other members of the senior team on a variety of projects/ tasks: from presentations and spreadsheets, to basic reporting and various growth initiatives
- Research: ranging from customer research to identifying new opportunities to supporting strategic decisions 
- Tracking the ROI of various growth channels to improve resource allocation and identify new growth curves
- Designing, releasing & improving a careers page to attract the next wave of Encord talent
- Ensure we keep our start-up atmosphere as we scale: plan and coordinate activities and events (e.g., team outings, in-office events etc.)
- Be integral part in growing the business – support Encord’s presence on social media, conferences and more  
- Crunching numbers on customer's usage of the product to help inform our Customer Success team's quarterly success planning

About you

- 2+ years of experience in high-intensity, high-velocity 1) startups, as an early-employee or founder 2) top-tier consulting, IB, PE or similar fast-paced environments.
- You're a do-er. You are happy to roll up your sleeves and get stuff done - from slides for an internal meeting to a demo for a client.
- You're an expert at taking end-to-end ownership of broad, ambiguous problems and thinking from first principles to achieve a result.
- You're obsessed with achieving an objective and getting results. You work best when given an outcome to aim towards, and iterating autonomously (collaborating with the rest of the team/pulling people in as needed) to find a way there. You don't take no for an answer; you are scrappy and resourceful.
- You're an entrepreneur and want to be a part of building a business from the ground up. You're good at context-switching and jumping from a candidate interview, to an excel model, to a vision-pitch draft.
- You're probably happiest when working really hard and solving challenging problems. You know this requires dedication and some sacrifice but you think it's worth it. You work hard and smartly - you're always thinking of ways to accomplish more with the time and energy you have.
- You're detail oriented and organized, and you proactively pull others in when you need help before you get stuck. Your team is always up to date on where projects are and rarely do you find things slip, even when covering a large surface area.

What We Offer

- Competitive salary, commission and equity in a hyper growth business.
- Strong in-person culture: most of our team is in the office 3+ days a week.
- Generous holiday allowance + public holidays.
- Annual learning and development budget.
- Paid trips to visit prospects, attend conferences, host events across UK, Europe and US.
- Company lunches twice a week.
- Monthly socials & bi-annual off-sites.

title: Operations Associate
description:
At Encord, we are focused on building the future of AI infrastructure. Data quality is the biggest challenge facing AI companies today. In fact, the success of any AI application depends on the quality of the model's training data — and for 95% of teams, this essential step is both the most costly and the most time-consuming, in getting their product to market.

As former computer scientists, physicists, and quants, we experienced firsthand the lack of tools for preparing quality training data, which hindered the progress of building AI for many teams. We founded Encord to address this gap and propel the next generation of AI applications.

We are a talented and ambitious team of 100+, working at the cutting edge of multimodal and visual AI, backed by top investors, including CRV and Y Combinator, leading industry executives like Luc Vincent, former VP of AI at Meta, and other top Bay Area leaders in AI. We are one the fastest growing companies in our space, and consistently rated as the best tool in the market by our customers.

The Role:
We are looking for a driven Operations Associate to join our team. In this pivotal role within the Encord Operations Team, you will be instrumental in onboarding new team members and enhancing existing processes to help us achieve our collective goals. This is a unique opportunity to influence the People Operations function at a fast-growing global company while contributing to outstanding employee experiences. Your contributions will play a crucial role in fostering a collaborative and efficient environment.

What you'll do:
- Oversee day-to-day office operations across our UK and US office, including scheduling, office management, and office supplies procurement to ensure a well-functioning and efficient workplace.
- Support the onboarding process including management of new starter’s equipment.
- Organise and manage company events and socials, ensuring all logistics are handled smoothly and the events promote team cohesion and morale.
- Support teams with conference related logistics, including travel arrangements, accommodation and merchandise procurement
- Assist with HR-related projects and initiatives.
- Support the wider team with operational support.

About you:
- Highly organised, with ability to manage multiple work priorities while delivering operations solutions at a high-growth pace. - Ability to build positive working relationships with cross-functional teams in a company. 
- Ability to problem solve and come up with innovative solutions to problems.

What We Offer:
- 25 days annual leave a year + public holidays.
- Competitive salary and equity in a hyper-growth business.
- Strong in-person culture: most of our team is in the office 3+ days a week.
- Room to grow into anything you choose to — a year ago we were 50 people, now we're over 100. We'll be growing insanely fast over the next 24 months and you'll have all the opportunities for growth as you can handle.

Encord offers a unique opportunity to be part of a startup with a clear mission and vision. You will get to explore and build services enterprise AI use cases across many different industry verticals such as healthcare, surveillance, retail, agriculture, and more.

description:
